intro: Uncinia angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, erect stems and linear, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Uncinia angustata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
